channel.title: 9.10 Upgrade Errors
channel.description:
I have had two problems since I upgraded to 9.10. The first is that these green lines appear on my screen, ones in the middle of the screen are the longest but you get the point from this screenshot:
[img]http://img408.imageshack.us/img408/9606/screenshot1uy.png[/img]
Second, Ubuntu is not detecting my touchpad mouse. I looked for it using "xinput list" in console, it isn't there. The touchpad is on a HP laptop and uses the Synaptics drivers.
If anyone has fixes for these, it would be appreciated.

item.title: 9.10 Upgrade Errors
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bjc22, post:9, topic:317183”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=413726.msg3052059#msg3052059 date=1260144109]
There is no way the filesystem type was causing this problem.

I haven’t upgraded to 9.10 yet, but plan to shortly.
[/quote]

I wouldn’t bother considering the unoffical kde3.5 version of it does not boot. The liveCD and installer on it works though.[/quote]

Worked fine for me, on my dad’s laptop.

I have since upgraded all of my computers to 9.10, using KDE 3.5 still, works perfectly.

Read full topic

I haven’t upgraded to 9.10 yet, but plan to shortly.[/quote]

I wouldn’t bother considering the unoffical kde3.5 version of it does not boot. The liveCD and installer on it works though.

item.title: 9.10 Upgrade Errors
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

yeah it wasn’t the filesystem, the reinstall is what helped. The different filesystem is just a plus

Read full topic

item.title: 9.10 Upgrade Errors
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

blah bah7:

it works now, i just reinstalled ubuntu. formatted as xfs this time, can’t tell too much of a difference between ext3 and xfs, but i heard it was better.

I doubt that the filesystem was the cause of this though.

Read full topic

I have had two problems since I upgraded to 9.10. The first is that these green lines appear on my screen, ones in the middle of the screen are the longest but you get the point from this screenshot:

Second, Ubuntu is not detecting my touchpad mouse. I looked for it using “xinput list” in console, it isn’t there. The touchpad is on a HP laptop and uses the Synaptics drivers.
